suggestions.market_question: Will Donald Trump win the 2028 Republican presidential nomination?
suggestions.reasoning: The current market price of 4.9% implies a high probability that Donald Trump will win the 2024 election (and thus be term-limited), or that he will not run if he loses. However, prediction markets currently show a volatile race for 2024. If Trump loses 2024, his probability of securing the 2028 nomination is historically very high for a former incumbent seeking a rematch (similar to Grover Cleveland). My estimated probability assumes a ~35-40% chance of a 2024 loss multiplied by a high conditional probability of running and winning the nomination in 2028. The edge exceeds the 10% threshold.
risk_factors: Trump wins the 2024 election (Contract resolves to NO due to term limits).
Trump chooses to retire from politics if he loses in 2024.
Health issues preventing a campaign in 2028.
key_findings: No search results were provided to update current polling data.
Analysis relies on the 22nd Amendment (Term Limits) which prevents a president from being elected more than twice.
If Donald Trump wins the 2024 Presidential Election, he is ineligible to run in 2028, rendering this market 'No'.
If Donald Trump loses in 2024, historical precedent and current polling suggest he would be the overwhelming frontrunner for the 2028 nomination should he choose to run.
